The Writer Mortis Project

Project Description: 

The Writer Mortis Project is an experiment with Ruby on Rails and storytelling.

It's a web app for writing collaborative stories like an exquisite corpse -- users contribute to a story by only seeing the chunk contributed by the previous user.

The Generation Open initiative has identified Writer Mortis as a potential collaboration tool for the Mozilla Webmaker project. You can view the project page a Generation Open http://genopen.org/g/content/writer-mortis

Created by Jason Blanchard
Project Link: 
http://www.writermortis.com/
Source Code: 
https://github.com/jasonblanchard/writermortis

#SVDM13

Project Description: 

This PHP Symfony app was created to display a live stream of pictures at the 2013 St. Valentine's Day Massacre party. The application uses the Twitter Search API to pull images from various image services (including Instagram). It is listening for Tweets @prtyplnt or containing the #svdm13 hashtag and has simple logic to prefer newer Tweets and to ensure Tweets are not repeated at too frequent intervals.

Created by Jason Blanchard
Project Link: 
http://svdm.blanktech.net/
Source Code: 
https://github.com/jasonblanchard/symfony-experiments

Philly ForagR

Project Description: 

Philly Foragr is a web-based app that promotes healthy living and well-being. Building on the Philly SNAP API developed at RHoK, we are adding public transit directions to supermarkets, grocery stores, etc. We will provide recipes to help make the healthy choice an easy choice. Since exercise is a solution to the obesity crisis, we are providing walking directions with information about historic markers, murals and other places of interest along the way.

Created by Chris Brown, Andrew Thompson, Jason Blanchard, Christopher Nies, Lauren Gilchrist, Faye Anderson, Max Freilich, and Brian Cohen at Random Hacks of Kindness
Project Link: 
http://phillyforagr.staterep.me/
Source Code: 
https://github.com/staterepme/phillyphoodaccess

Schedule Scraper

Project Description: 

Managing online courses across many term schedule pages is difficult. This data often changes and instructional designers and course administrators need quick access to the most recent state of courses for any particular term. This web app dynamically scrapes the Term Master Schedule and allows the user to view multiple programs in a single table. The user can save this search for future access and can download the result as an excel file for additional note-taking.

You can view a video of it in action on Vimeo.

Created by Jason Blanchard
Source Code: 
https://github.com/jasonblanchard/schedule-scraper

StateRep.Me

Project Description: 

The goal is to provide an easy to use web-app for Pennsylvanians to monitor their state representatives' activities on the web and in government. To that end, StateRep.Me seeks to provide not only raw information similar to websites and services like OpenStates, Project Vote Smart, and Follow the Money - which we rely on for some of our data - but to also provide context to this information for Pennsylvanians. Much of the data on our site is already out there; however, we feel it is hard for average citizens to aggregate and monitor the activities of their state representatives.

Created by Chris Brown, Christopher Nies, Lauren Gilchrist, Andrew Thompson, Jason Blanchard, Nick Weingartner, Charlie Milner, Joshua Darr, and Josh Borkowski at Hacks for Democracy
Project Link: 
http://staterep.me
Source Code: 
https://github.com/staterepme/State-Gov-Tracker
